page.title: 11MILKING
page.content: My name is Daphne Tweddle. I live at the Centurion Inn, Walton. I have to write about milking. On a farm a farmer usually milks twice a day in his milking parlour. In the parlour there is sets of cups to put on the cows udders and and the milk is sucked up into some big jars. Then the milk tanker would come and collect the milk and take it away. A good cow produces about 11\ gallons a day. Mr. Gibson has a helper called Ian Allen. He flushes the milk parlour out with 40 gallons of cold water then 40 gallons of hot water and chemical. And finally with 40 gallons of cold water. After that Mr Gibson puts his feet up and has a rest at the end of the day.
